name: MotoGP™14
description: MotoGP™14 is back with a comprehensively overhauled and improved graphics engine. New game modes, all the riders from the 2014 and 2013 seasons and legendary riders from the history of the MotoGP™ give you the chance to live the dream of being a real rider.

DirectX: Version 10 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 18 GB available space Additional Notes: Laptop versions of these cards are not fully supported. reviews.review_text: MotoGP 13 was okay (even rather good in places) but ultimately flawed. However, the improvements required were obvious and should have been easy for Milestone to fix. Well, they didn't - in fact, they've made it worse. Much, much worse.  There are virtually no graphics quality settings whatsoever and no AA control at all. In-game graphics are a bizarre mixture of out-of-focus fuzziness for when in the pit, to glossy realism on the podium, to a jagged mess (due to no AA) on the track. Bike control hasn't improved, still no proper XB360 controller for PC, exiting the game currently requires CTRL+ALT+DEL and Task Manager, tyre grip still isn't modelled, bike setup is still childishly pointless because it does so little. And now it's riddled with DLC.  I'm a big fan of MotoGP but how on Earth Dorna Sports can let such a potentially fantastic license be ruined by such inept software development is beyond me. Milestone claim to have fully revamped the game engine but the evidence for this is painfully absent.  Don't waste your money on this game.

As it stands? Nope. The game isn't finished, it isn't complete. The gameplay is fine, possibly even better than 2013's game, but that gets overlooked when you realize that the career mode only has half the riders it's meant to (and the others are 'day one' DLC that hasn't been released now some week and a half after the game was released.   It's quite disappointing for anyone who wanted to play career and is a fan of MotoGP or Moto2/3 that the riders they're looking forward to racing aren't actually taking part in the races.   There's a few new game modes, some of which are interesting, but for me at least, the lack of functioning career mode with all the riders (And the few bugs i've encountered - you can't exit the game if you play career mode, you have to alt+f4, etc) mean that I can't really recommend it. Wait and see, and perhaps it'll get better, if we ever get the support we want from the devs, that is.

Graphics are worse, glitchs all over the place(and I have a good gaming set up) and where in the hell did they record the bike sounds(sounds are like a cat fight at the bottom of a trash can). They had better come up with something stunning this year or say goodbye to one of the all time great run of racing sims. For god's sake don't buy, read the reviews (shame I didn't) Badman Bob

Ok, having played this game abit more with AFX turned off it is alot better and much improved compared to 13.  The riding is the best when set to full simulation and this is where it belongs and is most rewarding.  Some things lacking are the audio, GP bikes sound crazy but these are very flat. Track detail are very bland some circuit backdrops are beutiful in real life but in the game you rarely take notice of anything beyond the bland grass. Those who to to a track such as Philip Island will imediately notice the beatiful sea from the back straight or the lush mountains surounding Mugello. Makes world class tracks feel uninspiring.  Afew very basic bugs that shouldn't be there are  No way of exiting the game when you exit campaing mode. Yes that's right check the HUB it's the number 1 issue. You need to bring up the windows task manager and kill the proces..... ConTROLLs don't save properly sometimes it decides to choose to use saved controls and other times it doesn't. Research selection in Campaing mode gets reset if you restart the race, so sometime you may not get the research points you should have if you're research selection is on something that has just maxed out...  Can do better force feed back for controllers, some parts are very good but others not so. I still feel MotoGP 08 is better in this aspect and regarding the sound as well. Graphics are better here but track environment is much better in 08. Yes I am still comparing a 2014 game to a 2008 game....  The need for a perfect MotoGP game asside this is better than MotoGP 13 so I guess they're improving.   If there is anything they should keep from this game for the future is the ride mechanics/simulation. It's properly good. Everything else working please.
